ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow instructions](https://aka.ms/sentinel-barracudacloudfirewall-connector) to configure syslog streaming. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux machine with the Microsoft Sentinel agent installed for the Destination IP address.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Configure Cisco ACI system to send logs via syslog. [Follow these steps](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/1-x/basic-config/b_ACI_Config_Guide/b_ACI_Config_Guide_chapter_010.html#d2933e4611a1635) to configure Syslog Destination, Destination Group, and Syslog Source.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-1/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_3_1.html#ID58) to configure remote syslog collection locations in your Cisco ISE deployment.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/servers-unified-computing/ucs-manager/110265-setup-syslog-for-ucs.html#configsremotesyslog) to configure Cisco UCS to forward syslog. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device with the agent installed.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://doc.sophos.com/nsg/sophos-firewall/20.0/Help/en-us/webhelp/onlinehelp/AdministratorHelp/SystemServices/LogSettings/SyslogServerAdd/index.html) to enable syslog streaming. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/endpoint-security-and-management/endpoint-protection/all/Monitoring-Reporting-and-Enforcing-Compliance/viewing-logs-v7522439-d37e464/exporting-data-to-a-syslog-server-v8442743-d15e1107.html) to configure Symantec Endpoint Protection to forward syslog.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://aka.ms/sentinel-symantecvip-configurationsteps) to configure Symantec VIP Enterprise Gateway to forward syslog.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Configure Juniper SRX to forward syslog: [Traffic Logs](https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=KB16509&actp=METADATA) and [System Logs](https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=kb16502).
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** In Darktrace Threat Visualizer: Navigate to System Config > Modules > Microsoft Sentinel. Configure Server address and port 514. Enable Send Alerts and save.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** In Darktrace Threat Visualizer: Navigate to System Config > Modules > Microsoft Sentinel. Configure Server address and port 514. Enable Send Alerts and save.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://www.arubanetworks.com/techdocs/ClearPass/6.7/PolicyManager/Content/CPPM_UserGuide/Admin/syslogExportFilters_add_syslog_filter_general.htm) to configure Aruba ClearPass. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://www.arubanetworks.com/techdocs/ClearPass/6.7/PolicyManager/Content/CPPM_UserGuide/Admin/syslogExportFilters_add_syslog_filter_general.htm) to configure Aruba ClearPass. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/159509/generating-syslog-messages-from-data-los.html) to configure Symantec DLP to forward syslog.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/159509/generating-syslog-messages-from-data-los.html) to configure Symantec DLP to forward syslog.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Install and configure the Firepower eNcore eStreamer client. See the [full install guide](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/firepower/670/api/eStreamer_enCore/eStreamereNcoreSentinelOperationsGuide_409.html).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Install and configure the Firepower eNcore eStreamer client. See the [full install guide](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/firepower/670/api/eStreamer_enCore/eStreamereNcoreSentinelOperationsGuide_409.html).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Configure [Log Subscription](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/esa/esa14-0/user_guide/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_14-0/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_12_1_chapter_0100111.html#con_1134718). Select Consolidated Event Logs in Log Type field.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Configure [Log Subscription](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/esa/esa14-0/user_guide/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_14-0/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_12_1_chapter_0100111.html#con_1134718). Select Consolidated Event Logs in Log Type field.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Configure Citrix WAF to send syslog messages in CEF format. Find guides at [Citrix Support](https://support.citrix.com/). Follow [this guide](https://docs.citrix.com/en-us/citrix-adc/13/system/audit-logging/configuring-audit-logging.html) to forward logs to port 514 TCP.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Configure Citrix WAF to send syslog messages in CEF format. Find guides at [Citrix Support](https://support.citrix.com/). Follow [this guide](https://docs.citrix.com/en-us/citrix-adc/13/system/audit-logging/configuring-audit-logging.html) to forward logs to port 514 TCP.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Navigate to Configuration > Syslog > Add. Configure Remote Server IP, Port, Protocol, and set Message Format to CEF. Save.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Navigate to Configuration > Syslog > Add. Configure Remote Server IP, Port, Protocol, and set Message Format to CEF. Save.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/tech-center/integrate-with-your-siem/) to deploy the SIEM Collector and forward syslog.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these instructions](https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/tech-center/integrate-with-your-siem/) to deploy the SIEM Collector and forward syslog.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** On the EPV, configure dbparm.ini to send syslog messages in CEF format to the proxy machine on port 514 TCP.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** On the EPV, configure dbparm.ini to send syslog messages in CEF format to the proxy machine on port 514 TCP.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Go to [F5 Configuring Application Security Event Logging](https://aka.ms/asi-syslog-f5-forwarding). Set Remote storage type to CEF, Protocol to UDP, IP address to syslog server, port to 514.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Go to [F5 Configuring Application Security Event Logging](https://aka.ms/asi-syslog-f5-forwarding). Set Remote storage type to CEF, Protocol to UDP, IP address to syslog server, port to 514.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Set Fortinet to send Syslog messages in CEF format to port 514 TCP. Replace 'server <ip address>' with the Syslog agent IP. See [Fortinet Document Library](https://aka.ms/asi-syslog-fortinet-fortinetdocumentlibrary). [Learn more](https://aka.ms/CEF-Fortinet)

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Set Fortinet to send Syslog messages in CEF format to port 514 TCP. Replace 'server <ip address>' with the Syslog agent IP. See [Fortinet Document Library](https://aka.ms/asi-syslog-fortinet-fortinetdocumentlibrary). [Learn more](https://aka.ms/CEF-Fortinet)

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Navigate to Reporting & Analytics > Log Forwarding > Forward From Reporter. Add Service, toggle to Microsoft Sentinel, input Workspace ID/Primary Key. See [iboss documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-cef-device#iboss).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Navigate to Reporting & Analytics > Log Forwarding > Forward From Reporter. Add Service, toggle to Microsoft Sentinel, input Workspace ID/Primary Key. See [iboss documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-cef-device#iboss).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these steps](https://docs.trendmicro.com/en-us/enterprise/trend-micro-apex-central-2019-online-help/detections/logs_001/syslog-forwarding.aspx) to configure Apex Central. On step 6, select log format CEF.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** [Follow these steps](https://docs.trendmicro.com/en-us/enterprise/trend-micro-apex-central-2019-online-help/detections/logs_001/syslog-forwarding.aspx) to configure Apex Central. On step 6, select log format CEF.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Forward events to the syslog agent using CEF format. See [this knowledge article](https://aka.ms/Sentinel-trendmicro-kblink) and [these instructions](https://aka.ms/Sentinel-trendMicro-connectorInstructions). Save the [TrendMicroDeepSecurity](https://aka.ms/TrendMicroDeepSecurityFunction) function.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Set TippingPoint SMS to send syslog messages in ArcSight CEF Format v4.2 format to the proxy machine on port 514 TCP.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** From Vectra UI: Settings > Notifications > Edit syslog configuration. Add Destination with port 514, UDP, CEF format. Enable all log types and Test.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** From Vectra UI: Settings > Notifications > Edit syslog configuration. Add Destination with port 514, UDP, CEF format. Enable all log types and Test.
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Set Zscaler product to send syslog messages in CEF format to port 514 TCP. See [Zscaler Microsoft Sentinel integration guide](https://aka.ms/ZscalerCEFInstructions).
ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Set Zscaler product to send syslog messages in CEF format to port 514 TCP. See [Zscaler Microsoft Sentinel integration guide](https://aka.ms/ZscalerCEFInstructions).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `ApacheHTTPServer_CL`. Log locations: Windows: `C:\Server\bin\log\Apache24\logs\*.log`, Linux: `/var/log/httpd/*.log`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#apache-http-server).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `Tomcat_CL`. Log location (Linux): `/var/log/tomcat/*.log`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#apache-tomcat).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `meraki_CL`. Configure syslog daemon with filtering for flows, urls, ids-alerts, events, ip_flow_start, ip_flow_end. [Configure Meraki syslog](https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Monitoring_and_Reporting/Meraki_Device_Reporting_-_Syslog%2C_SNMP%2C_and_API). See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#cisco-meraki).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `meraki_CL`. [Configure Meraki syslog](https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Monitoring_and_Reporting/Meraki_Device_Reporting_-_Syslog%2C_SNMP%2C_and_API) for log forwarding.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `meraki_CL`. [Configure Meraki syslog](https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Monitoring_and_Reporting/Meraki_Device_Reporting_-_Syslog%2C_SNMP%2C_and_API) for log forwarding.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `meraki_CL`. [Configure Meraki syslog](https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Monitoring_and_Reporting/Meraki_Device_Reporting_-_Syslog%2C_SNMP%2C_and_API) for log forwarding.

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `JBossLogs_CL`. Log locations (Linux): Standalone: `{EAP_HOME}/standalone/log/server.log`, Managed domain: `{EAP_HOME}/domain/servers/{SERVER_NAME}/log/server.log`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#jboss-enterprise-application-platform).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `JuniperIDP_CL`. Configure rsyslog ruleset with UDP input. [Configure Juniper IDP syslog](https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/SRX-Getting-Started-Configure-System-Logging). See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#juniperidp).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `MarkLogicAudit_CL`. Log locations: Windows: `C:\Program Files\MarkLogic\Data\Logs\AuditLog.txt`, Linux: `/var/opt/MarkLogic/Logs/AuditLog.txt`. Enable auditing in MarkLogic Admin interface. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#marklogic-audit) and [MarkLogic auditing docs](https://docs.marklogic.com/guide/admin/auditing).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `MongoDBAudit_CL`. Log locations: Windows: `C:\data\db\auditlog.json`, Linux: `/data/db/auditlog.json`. Configure `dbpath` and `path` in mongod.cfg/mongod.conf. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#mongodb-audit) and [MongoDB auditing docs](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/tutorial/configure-auditing/).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `NGINX_CL`. Log location (Linux): `/var/log/nginx.log`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#nginx-http-server).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `OracleWebLogicServer_CL`. Log locations: Windows: `{DOMAIN_NAME}\Servers\{SERVER_NAME}\logs*.log`, Linux: `{DOMAIN_HOME}/servers/{SERVER_NAME}/logs/*.log`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#oracle-weblogic-server).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `PostgreSQL_CL`. Log locations: Windows: `C:\*.log`, Linux: `/var/log/*.log`. Configure `log_destination='stderr'` and `logging_collector=on`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#postgresql-events) and [PostgreSQL logging docs](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/runtime-config-logging.html).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `SecurityBridgeLogs_CL`. Log location (Linux): `/usr/sap/tmp/sb_events/*.cef`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#securitybridge-threat-detection-for-sap).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `SecurityBridgeLogs_CL`. Log location (Linux): `/usr/sap/tmp/sb_events/*.cef`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#securitybridge-threat-detection-for-sap).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `SquidProxy_CL`. Log locations: Windows: `C:\Squid\var\log\squid\*.log`, Linux: `/var/log/squid/*.log`. See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#squidproxy).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `Ubiquiti_CL`. Configure rsyslog ruleset with UDP input. Enable syslog in controller: Settings > System Settings > Controller Configuration > Remote Logging. [Follow Ubiquiti instructions](https://help.ui.com/hc/en-us/categories/6583256751383). See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#ubiquiti-unifi).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `vcenter_CL`. Configure rsyslog with template and filtering for vpxd/vcenter-server messages. [Configure vCenter syslog](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere.monitoring.doc/GUID-9633A961-A5C3-4658-B099-B81E0512DC21.html). See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#vmware-vcenter).

ðŸ› ï¸ **Device Configuration:** Table: `ZPA_CL`. Configure rsyslog ruleset with UDP input. Select JSON as log template. [Configure ZPA log receiver](https://help.zscaler.com/zpa/configuring-log-receiver). See [Custom Logs via AMA configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/unified-connector-custom-device#zscaler-private-access-zpa).
